definition: abbr. for Canada 加拿大[Jia1 na2 da4]/surname Jia

to add/plus/(used after an adverb such as 不, 大, 稍 etc, and before a disyllabic verb, to indicate that the action of the verb is applied to sth or sb previously mentioned)/to apply (restrictions etc) to (sb)/to give (support, consideration etc) to (sth)
to go forward/to advance/to go in/to enter/to put in/to submit/to take in/to admit/(math.) base of a number system/classifier for sections in a building or residential compound

sentences.english: Further Practice for Pairs ·Add a third speaker and create your own lines.
sentences.chinese: 加进圈外人，创作你们自己的对话。

sentences.english: The trick is to add that food into your meals in very small amounts.
sentences.chinese: 小窍门就是往你的饭菜中加进少量的此种食物。

sentences.english: So this is where the mixing of the solute comes in.
sentences.chinese: 这是加进来的溶质混合引起的。

sentences.english: You have added too much liquid to the mixture.
sentences.chinese: 你给这混合物加进了过多的液体。

sentences.english: She wrote in some examples in her paper.
sentences.chinese: 她在论文里加进了一些实例。

sentences.english: Centola recruited more than 1,500 participants for what was billed as a Web-based health community.
sentences.chinese: 森特拉把1500多名用户加进了一个网络卫生社区。

sentences.english: Can you add me in? thank.
sentences.chinese: 把我也加进去吧？谢谢老帅。

sentences.english: Fold in the beaten whites of two eggs.
sentences.chinese: 加进两个打散的蛋清后搅匀。

sentences.english: Focus on a variety of seasonal berries and add them to plain, no-fat yogurt.
sentences.chinese: 把各种时令浆果加进清淡无脂的酸奶中，效果更好。

sentences.english: Add the egg and vanilla extract and beat to combine.
sentences.chinese: 把鸡蛋和香草粉加进去，打匀。

sentences.english: Well, the woodsman was a later addition to the tale.
sentences.chinese: 其实这个樵夫是后来加进故事的。

sentences.english: They didn't add the actual new piece of information that came out yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 他们没有把昨天刚出的真实新闻信息加进来。

sentences.english: So I included Rieann in my Powa service.
sentences.chinese: 因此我将她加进颇瓦超度之列。

sentences.english: I was worried, so I went to look for him after school. I found him running all alone. I asked him how he felt.
sentences.chinese: 毫无疑问小琼尼看到他们玩就会马上加进去跑啊闹的。

sentences.english: Ugh! I already smell it. Two things go in.
sentences.chinese: 额，我已经闻到了，两样东西加进去。

sentences.english: Please add these names on to your list.
sentences.chinese: 请把这些名字加进你的名单里。

definition: to become a member/to join/to mix into/to participate in/to add in
to work extra hours/to do overtime
to feed in/to load (raw material, supplies, fuel etc)/to supply/fortified (with added material)
abbr. for Canada 加拿大[Jia1 na2 da4]/surname Jia

to add/plus/(used after an adverb such as 不, 大, 稍 etc, and before a disyllabic verb, to indicate that the action of the verb is applied to sth or sb previously mentioned)/to apply (restrictions etc) to (sb)/to give (support, consideration etc) to (sth)
mix together/put together (usu. things that do not blend well together)
